sentences.sContent: In the June elections, Morris easily defeated the incumbent, Tom Smith.
sentences.sCn: 在6月的大选中，莫里斯轻松击败了在任的汤姆·史密斯。

synos.tran: [管理]现任的；依靠的；负有职责的

remMethod.val: in + cumb(躺) + ent → 躺在(职位)上的人 → 在职者

trans.tranOther: someone who has been elected to an official position, especially in politics, and who is doing that job at the present time
